messages.title: A better plan A better future
messages.content: We will build a Britain that rewards hard work, not just privilege, and ensures the next generation does better than the last.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Higher living standards for working families
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Freeze energy bills until 2017 and give regulator powers to cut bills, ban exploitative zero-hours contracts, raise the minimum wage to £8 per hour and provide 25 hours free childcare per week.
Balance the books and cut the deficit every year while securing the future of the NHS. None of our manifesto commitments require additional borrowing.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: An NHS with the time to care
keyPolicies.policyDescription: 20,000 more nurses and 8,000 more GPs. We will join up services from home to hospital, guarantee GP appointments within 48 hours and cancer tests within one week.
People who come to the UK they won't be able to claim benefits for at least two years and we will introduce fair rules making it illegal for employers to undercut wages by exploiting workers.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: A country where our children can do better than the last
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Tuition fees reduced to £6,000, an apprenticeship for every school leaver who achieves the basic grades, and smaller class sizes for 5, 6, 7 year-olds.

issues.economy: Balance the books and cut the deficit every year while securing the future of the NHS. None of our manifesto commitments require additional borrowing.
issues.education: Tuition fees reduced to £6,000, an apprenticeship for every school leaver who achieves the basic grades, and smaller class sizes for 5, 6, 7 year-olds.
issues.environment: Fortnightly recycling and free garden waste collections.
issues.governance: Despite the Coalition Government's cuts of £56m to your local service funding we have; Carried out millions of pounds worth of repairs to our Council Housing stock and will do more next year.
issues.health: 20,000 more nurses and 8,000 more GPs. We will join up services from home to hospital, guarantee GP appointments within 48 hours and cancer tests within one week.
issues.immigration: People who come to the UK they won't be able to claim benefits for at least two years and we will introduce fair rules making it illegal for employers to undercut wages by exploiting workers.

housing.content: Carried out millions of pounds worth of repairs to our Council Housing stock and will do more next year. Planned to build 300 new affordable homes and continue to renew and refurbish our sheltered housing schemes.

leaflet.personalStatement: I was born and brought up in North Shields and have lived in Wallsend for nearly 40 years, so I fully understand the changes and concerns that people face here, particularly in these tough economic times.

politicalExperience.achievements: In my capacity as your MP, I have been proud to work on behalf of all my constituents.
I have been one of your local councillors for 17 years and during that time I have worked hard to help and support local people on a wide range of issues and to do so.

contactInformation.address: Promoted by Eddie Darke on behalf of Mary Glindon and Janet Hunter, printed by North Tyneside Labour at 7/8/9 Riverside Newcastle upon Tyne NE21 4PN

endorsements.endorsement: Re-elect Mary Glindon & Janet Hunter on the 7th May 2015

images.caption: Labour in North Tyneside is DELIVERING FOR ALL
